result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry Fernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Larry Fernandez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Larry Fernandez was found guilty of Hiding a Corpse [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.11(2).
  • Larry Fernandez was found guilty of Hiding a Corpse [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.11(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Count Three and Eau Claire County case 12CF774

superMiscConds.notes: Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

Defendant Larry  Fernandez in court with attorney John M. O'Boyle.  Defendant Larry  Fernandez in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties believe there is an error on the G Felony time sentence, believing it would be 5 years max.  State enters argument.  Victims family reads statement to the court.  Atty makes statement to the court.  Mr Fernandez makes a statement to the court.  The court addresses DE.  
Ct 1-5 yrs, 2.5 in/2.5 out
Ct 3-10 yrs total, 5 in/5 out.  Counts will be consecutive to each other,  and consecutive to Eau Claire County Case,  DE will pay CC.  No credit for time served.

Defendant Larry  Fernandez in court with attorney John M. O'Boyle.  Andrea Amidon Nodolf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Oral ruling on motion to dismiss the counts in the information, the court will make counts one and three available to the State, will dismiss count two.  A written decision on counts one and three will be faxed to the parties by monday.  Mr Fernandez would like to enter a plea to counts one and three.  Court instructs on plea quesionnarie/waiver of rights.  State requests a PSI, Atty will waive PSI.  Ct 1-plea of G, Ct 3-plea of G.  The court will accept DE's plea on both counts and find the DE guilty.  Court will order a PSI be prepared for sentencing purposes.  When PSI is prepared the court will set for sentencing.

Defendant Larry  Fernandez in court with attorney Karl J Kelz appearing telephonic.  Defendant Larry  Fernandez in custody appearing  from the jail.  Andrea A Nodolf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Kelz's has made a motion to withdraw as counsel due to a prior PD appointment.  Mr Fernandez is explained the situation, there is PD counsel that will be assigned to this case but will not be able to honor the speedy trial demand.  Court will allow Atty Kelz's to withdraw.  Mr O'Boyle will be counsel appointed.  The current JT will be removed from the calendar, and rescheduled asap.

Defendant Larry  Fernandez in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Andrea Amidon Nodolf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court contacts the victims families via telephone.  Motion to suppress is being withdrawn by Atty Kelz and Defendant.  Court is satisfied with Defendant's response, will deny the motion for suppression.  State moves to quash warrant, and amend bond to a sign bond.  Court will quash warrant.  Atty objects to sign bond.  State requests rescheduling of JT.  Set JT for May 13,14,15.  State will withdraw motion to join cases.  Defendant will not sign signature bond if allowed.  Cash bond will remain at this time.  Set motion date for MIL, 5-7-14 @ 4:00, Atty Kelz will appear telephonic. Defendant will not sign cash or signature bond.
